TEI.2.document_title: Moses Austin to James E. B. Austin, 02-02-1820

barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Original in possession of Mrs. Emmett L. Perry.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 353

div1.p: I have only time to say that your Dear mother is as well as could be expected I have lately returned home and found your letter inclose you have 20 Dollars its the best and only money now to be had in this County I hope It may do you some good Next mail I hope I may send you 50 Dollars to discharge all your bill I have sent to Washington to have arrangements made for you on board the Navy by April so that you must make all the deligence you can
God Bless you and Keep you my Dear Son Your Aff Father
[Addressed:] Mr James. E B Austin Nicholisville Kentucky
